heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: A storm is passing through the area.  This marks the first storm since 30 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (197°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.7 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (down 167 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 233 m), feels like temperature (down 2.3°C), dew point temperature (down 2.4°C), and outside temperature (down 2.0°C) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 167.5m higher than yesterday, 156.5m lower than the past week, 233.1m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 696m and a high of 976m, averaging 1002.0m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, humidity should not be a concern and winds will be practically absent. Possible light showers, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and it’s dark. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
